thread.title: LG X400 with 5.3-inch HD display, 32GB storage and Android Nougat launched
thread.title_full: LG X400 with 5.3-inch HD display, 32GB storage and Android Nougat launched

title: LG X400 with 5.3-inch HD display, 32GB storage and Android Nougat launched
text:
LG X400 with 5.3-inch HD display, 32GB storage and Android Nougat launched LG X400 with 5.3-inch HD display, 32GB storage and Android Nougat launched By February 21, 2017 “The LG X400 features a fingerprint sensor, 13MP/5MP cameras, 4G LTE and a 2,800mAh battery” 
Earlier this year, LG launched the X300 5-incher running Android Nougat out of the box in its home market of South Korea. Now the company has added yet another smartphone to the X series with the launch of the LG X400 in South Korea. Similar to its predecessor, the X400 also sports a fingerprint sensor that’s located at its back and boots Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box. 
The LG X400 features a 5.3-inch HD In-Cell display with a 2.5D curved glass on top. It is powered by a 1.5GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor, mated to 2GB of RAM and Mali T860 graphics. It comes with 32GB of internal memory, which can be further expanded up to 2TB by inserting a microSD card. 
The camera department on the LG X400 includes a 13-megapixel primary snapper with an LED flash and a 5-megapixel secondary shooter with a 120-degree wide angle lens. The phone offers 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2, GPS and NFC for connectivity. It is fuelled by a 2,800mAh removable battery. 
The LG X400 has been priced at 3,19,000 Won, roughly Rs 18,700. The phone will be available in gold, and black with gold hues.
